intro: Anacampseros wischkonii var. levis, commonly known as the Wiscconna Anacampseros, is a succulent plant native to the arid regions of California. It features fleshy, paddle-shaped leaves that are typically blue-green in color, often with a waxy coating to reduce water loss. The plant produces small, yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. It thrives in well-draining soil and requires minimal water, making it suitable for rock gardens or xeriscaping. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
